metadata.title: CVE-2023-3776 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's net/sched: cls_fwcomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Iftcf_change_indev() fails, fw_set_parms() will immediately return an errorafter incrementing or decrementing the reference counter intcf_bind_filter(). If an attacker can control the reference counter and setit to zero, they can cause the reference to be freed, leading to ause-after-free vulnerability. We recommend upgrading past commit0323bce598eea038714f941ce2b22541c46d488f.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3776` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was pending').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-5.5.1').
